content.raw:
Hey,
my name is Lars Kohfahl and I am currently keeping labscript in Darmstadt, Germany up to date after Jan Werkmann finished his masters thesis.
I now came across a problem where I do not know if it is an error from my side or some bug:
When updating hdf5 (to 1.10.2) or h5py (to 2.8.0) with conda and starting lyse afterwards, a window pops up saying "python does not work anymore" and an error message is displayed saying that there is a "HDF5 library version mismatched error" saying that the versions of the headers and the library do not match.
I can reproduce this error in Python 2 and Python 3.
I have attached the error messages for Py2 and Py3. Note that in Py2 I first updated HDF5 and then h5py, in Py3 I did it the other way around.
Can anyone help my how to solve it?
